questions.title: What is a hackathon?
questions.answer: A hackathon is an event where students with common interests from all over the nation come together and collaborate on a project over a 36-hour period.

questions.title: Who can come?
questions.answer: All college students (both graduate and undergraduate) are welcome! No prior experience is necessary.

questions.title: What can I build?
questions.answer: If you can think it, you can build it. We encourage students to build technological projects, whether they be software or hardware.

questions.title: What if I don't have a team or idea?
questions.answer: Not a problem. There will be time at the beginning of the hackathon to find other students who don't have a team yet!

questions.title: What should I bring?
questions.answer: Bring your ID, computer, and sleeping bag (optional). All the necessary equipment for hardware projects will be provided. We'll also have a hardware lab with a variety of devices and parts.

questions.title: How much does it cost?
questions.answer: Food and admission are absolutely FREE! Buses will be provided for students traveling within California.

questions.title: How will I get there?
questions.answer: We will be providing buses for Californian hackers, and case-by-case flight reimbursements for out-of-state hackers. Check your email upon acceptance for more details!

questions.title: Still have questions?
questions.answer: Feel free to shoot us an email at team@slohacks.com or contact us on Facebook.
